content.raw:
@iche033 Thanks for the details. We moved a step forward but not enough. Here are the details:

1. Gazebo started on the Docker container in Simulator instance but it failed in the first run. after clicking stop and then >1 on the cloudsim portal, it appeared to work fine.
2. fcomputer compiled and loaded fine in field computer and we were able to get our communication server talking with the OCU. Opening ports and socket communication work fine.

3. After running for 102 simulation seconds, the real time factor on gazebo went down to 0.06 `Factor[0.06] SimTime[102.28] RealTime[1367.31] Paused[F]` 
4. Container on field computer stopped and the client connection with server running inside docker got disconnected. At this point, when I clicked on the public IP of field computer in cloudsim, it returned `This site can’t be reached`.
content.html:
@iche033 Thanks for the details. We moved a step forward but not enough. Here are the details:

  1. Gazebo started on the Docker container in Simulator instance but it failed in the first run. after clicking stop and then >1 on the cloudsim portal, it appeared to work fine.

  2. fcomputer compiled and loaded fine in field computer and we were able to get our communication server talking with the OCU. Opening ports and socket communication work fine.

  3. After running for 102 simulation seconds, the real time factor on gazebo went down to 0.06 Factor[0.06] SimTime[102.28] RealTime[1367.31] Paused[F]

  4. Container on field computer stopped and the client connection with server running inside docker got disconnected. At this point, when I clicked on the public IP of field computer in cloudsim, it returned This site can’t be reached.
